node.statement: STRICTNESS FOR n>=3: When n >= 3, the Cauchy-Schwarz inequality in Step 1.5.3 is strict unless H_p and H_q are proportional (as vectors in R^n). Show that proportionality H_p(mu_i)/H_q(nu_i) = const for all i forces p and q to have identical gap ratios, which generically fails, giving strict inequality 1/Phi_n(r) > 1/Phi_n(p) + 1/Phi_n(q) for n >= 3.
